meanings.definition: Serving to make a fault, offense, etc., appear less serious
meanings.sent1: Her extenuatory explanation softened the impact of her mistake.
meanings.sent2: The extenuatory circumstances led to a more lenient punishment.
meanings.sent3: His extenuatory reasoning made everyone chuckle at the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent4: The extenuatory light she painted herself in made her seem like a hero.
meanings.sent5: The extenuatory nature of his actions made forgiveness easy.

meanings.definition: Tending to mitigate or excuse wrongdoing
meanings.sent1: The extenuatory evidence lessened the blame on the accused.
meanings.sent2: Her extenuatory words helped ease the tension in the room.
meanings.sent3: The extenuatory tone of his voice made it hard to stay mad at him.
meanings.sent4: His extenuatory gestures spoke louder than words.
meanings.sent5: The extenuatory influence of her presence made forgiveness seem natural.
